//About Us Application Information 
	We want to help you live a fit and healthy lifestyle! We do this by providing you many such workouts. We believe that building a positive culture is incredibly important. 

	We work hard to ensure we have strong relationships with our customers, bringing you the best possible workouts. We are an ambitious company and we’re always looking for great people to join our team. 

	We combine different types of fitness exercises to meet different fitness needs and levels. Our awesome team is always keen to help, so please call us to discuss your needs.
 Contributors 	Gaikwad Dipak
	Hambir Akshay
	Gandhi Kalpesh
	Chavhan Shantanu

// MENU items Workout Stop Watch

//WORKOUTS NAME Abdominal Crunches Arm Scissors Backward Lunges Bicycle Crunches Burpees Cobra Stretch Forward Lunges Inchworms Jumping Jack Jumping Squats Mountain Climbers Push Ups Side Hop Skipping Without Rope Squats Incline Push Ups Box Push Ups Knee Push Ups Wide Arm Push Ups Chest Stertch Side Lying Leg Lift Left Side Lying Leg Lift Right Donkey Kicks Left Donkey Kicks Right Left Quad Stretch With Wall Right Quad Stretch With Wall Knee To Chest Stretch Left Knee To Chest Stretch Right Hindu Push Ups Staggered Push Ups Push Ups And Rotation Decline Push Ups Spiderman Push Ups Russian Twist Heel Touch Leg Raises Plank Spine Lumber Twist Strech Left Spine Lumber Twist Strech Right Crossover Crunch Side Bridges Left Side Bridges Right Butt Bridge V-Up Side Plank Left Side Plank Right Sit Ups Arm Raises Side Arm Raises Triceps Dips Arm Circles Clockwise Arm Circles Counter Clockwise Diamond Push Ups Leg Barbell Curl Left Leg Barbell Curl Right Diagonal Plank Wall Push Ups Triceps Stretch Left Triceps Stretch Right Standing Biceps Stretch Left Standing Biceps Stretch Right Floor Triceps Dips Military Push Ups Alternating Hooks Arm Curl Crunch Left Arm Curl Crunch Stretcher Raises Wall Resisting Single Leg Calf Raise Left Wall Resisting Single Leg Calf Raise Right
//Workout Steps 
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and your arms stretched forward.
2. Then lift your upper body off the floor. Hold for a few seconds and slowly return. It primarily works the rectus abdomens muscle and the oblique.
 
1. Stand upright with your feet should wide apart.
2. Stretch your arms in front of you at shoulder height with one arm overlap the other in the shape of the letter ‘X’, and then spread them apart.
3. Switch arms, and repeat the exercise.
 
1. Stand tall with your hip distance apart.
2. Take a large step backward and lower your body toward the floor. Both legs should be bent at a 90-degree angle at the bottom of the lunge. Rise back to start and repeat.
 
1. Start on your back with your hands behind your head. Lift your right knee toward your chest with your left leg straight and lifted a few inches up.
2. Lift your upper body up. Draw your knee to the opposite elbow, alternating sides.
 
1. Begin in a standing position. Sit into a squat and place your hands on ground outside your feet.
2. Kick both feet outside you and land in push up position, keep the hips up and core engage. Take the chest to the ground at the bottom of the push up. Press up from the bottom of push up and return feet to hands.
3. Return to standing by jumping off the ground, clapping hands overhead.
 
1. To begin the pose lie flat on the floor with your belly facing down and place your hands underneath the shoulders.
2. Tense your legs, contract your thighs and press feet firmly into the floor.
3. Then push your chest up off the ground as far as possible.
 
1. Step forward with a leg and bend it until both legs are in a 90 degree angle.
2. Push through your front heel to activate your glutes and back to the starting position.
 
1. Stand tall and down until your hands reach the floor. Walk your hands forward until you’re one long line in a plank position.
2. Take tiny steps walking your feet forward until they reach your hands. Walk hands out to plank again, and feet backs to hands.
 
1. Begin by standing with your legs straight and your arms to your sides.
2. Jump up and spread your feet beyond hip width apart while building your arms above your head, nearly touching.
3. Jump again, lowering your arms and bringing your legs together.
 
1. Start in a squat position, then jump using your abdominal muscles for strength. This exercise works for your abdomen.
 
1. Make your knees as high as you can. Keep your head straight with your waist in a steady horizontal position.
2. Screw your hands into the floor to create a tension and solid upper body. Your elbows and biceps should face forward.
 
1. Place your hands slightly wider than your shoulders. Bend your arms until your chest almost touches the ground.
2. Maintain a straight body throughout the movement. Make it easier by placing your knees on the ground.
3. Screw your hands into the floor to create a tension and solid upper body. Your elbows and biceps should face forward.
 
1. Stand on the floor, put your hands in front you and hop side to side.
 
1. Place your arms at your sides and pretend to hold a skipping rope handle in each hand.
2. Jump and alternately land on the balls of your feet, rotating your wrists at the same time as if you were spinning a rope.
 
1. Stand straight with feet hip width apart. Stand with your feet apart, directly under your hips.
2. Standing up tall, put your shoulders back, lift up your chest and pull in your abdominal muscles.
3. Bend your knees while keeping your upper body as straight as possible. Lower yourself as far as you can without leaning your upper body more than few inches forward.
4. Being careful not to lock your knees when you reach a standing position, straighten your legs. Repeat the movement.
 
1. Place your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart on a bench or other stable, elevated surface and assume a high plank position with your feet together and body straight from head to heels.
2. Keeping your back flat and core engaged, lower your chest to within a few inches of the benches.
3. Pause, and then push yourself back up to starting position.
 
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands directly under your shoulders.
2. Bend your elbows and do a push-up.
3. Return to the start position and repeat.
 
1. Start in the regular push-up position, then let your knees touch the floor and raise your feet up off the floor.
2. Next push your body up and down.
 
1. Begin in your top of push-up position with your arms straight and your wrist underneath your shoulders.
2. Step each hand a few inches wider. As you inhale, bend your elbows out to the sides as you lower your torso toward the floor.
 
1. Stand in middle of a doorway with one foot in front of the other. Bend your elbows to a 90-degree angle and place your forearms on each side of the doorway.
2. Shift your leg onto your front leg, leaning forward until you feel a stretch in your chest muscles. Hold this position for 20 seconds.
 
1. Lie down on your right arm. The arm that’s closest to the floor shoulder while your left arm is bent with your hand on your hip. Your legs should be extended and stacked on top of one another.
2. Slowly raise your left leg as high as you can. Pause, and then return to the starting position.
 
1. Lie down on your left arm. The arm that’s closest to the floor shoulder while your right arm is bent with your hand on your hip. Your legs should be extended and stacked on top of one another.
2. Slowly raise your right leg as high as you can. Pause, and then return to the starting position.
 
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands under your shoulders.
2. Then lift your left leg and squeeze your butt as much as you can. Go back to the start position and repeat.
 
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands under your shoulders.
2. Then lift your right leg and squeeze your butt as much as you can. Go back to the start position and repeat.
 
1. Stand with your side to the wall, placing a right hand on the wall for balance.
2. Hold your left foot with your left hand and lift the foot up toward your rear end, keeping your thighs and knees together. Hold this position.
 
1. Stand with your side to the wall, placing a right hand on the wall for balance.
2. Hold your right foot with your right hand and lift the foot up toward your rear end, keeping your thighs and knees together. Hold this position.
 
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent. Bring left knee into your hands and gently let your arms pull your knee toward your chest.
2. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent. Bring right knee into your hands and gently let your arms pull your knee toward your chest.
2. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. Start with your feet and hands a little more than shoulder width apart, forming your body into an upside down ‘V’ and keeping your head, neck and spine aligned. The arms are touching the ears in this position.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your chest down and forward. Keep pushing forward and up until your body is in the cobra position. From there, push your body straight back to the starting position and repeat.
 
1. Start in push-up position with your body in a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles. Stagger your heads. Place one hand slightly forward while the remains under your shoulders.
2. Lower your body so your elbows are 90 degrees ans return to starting position. Switch other hand in front and repeat.
 
1. Engage your core as you twist your torso. As one hand is supporting your body move the other straight above your head.
2. Keep both arms in line with each other and your shoulders. Make it easier by placing your knees on the ground.
 
1. Place your feet on a bench or a raised platform and get into the pushup position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
2. With your feet on the bench and your arms holding your body up, begin exercise by lowering yourself down to the ground while keeping your entire body in a straight line.
3. Lower your chest as close to the ground as you can, pause, then push yourself back to starting position.
 
1. Get into push-up position with your shoulders over your wrists and your body is one line from your shoulders to your ankles.
2. Lower down to the bottom of push-ups. As you do so , draw your right knee up toward your right elbow keeping your thigh parallel with ground.
3. As you press up , strengthen your right leg and return your right foot to the floor. Repeat on the other side.
 
1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent , feet lifted a little bit and back titled backwards.
2. Then hold your hands together and twist from side to side.
 
1. Lie down with your back on the ground and your knees bent and pointed towards the ceiling. With your arms on your side raise your shoulders slightly off the ground.
2. Using your abs rotate your right hand down to your right foot and then back up. Then do the same thing with your left hand.
 
1. Lay down with your back flat on the floor , feet straight out and together and your hands on your side.
2. While keep your legs as straight as you can lift your feet up in the air between 6-12 inches.
3. You can either hold for designated period of time or you can raise them up and then lower them right back down. This completes one repetition.
 
1. Start in a pushup position with your hands directly under your shoulders.
2. Bend your elbows and lower yourself down until you can shift your weight from your hands to your forearms. Contract your abs and glutes. Hold for up to 20 seconds.
 
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended.
2. Lift your leg up and use your right hand to pull your left knee to the right , but keep your other arm extended to the side on the floor.
3. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended.
2. Lift your right leg up and use your left hand to pull your right knee to the left, but keep your other arm extended to the side on the floor.
3. Hold this position for a 30 seconds.
 
1. Lie on your knees bent and your hands behind your ears.
2. Raise and twist your torso so your right elbow moves to meet your left knee. Repeat with the other side.
 
1. Lie on your right side. Use your right elbow to support upper body. Put your left hand on your waist.
2. Contract your core and raise your hips until your body is in a straight line from head to feet. Hold the position without letting your hips drop for the allotted time. Then go back to the start position and repeat.
 
1. Lie on your left side. Use your left elbow to support upper body. Put your right hand on your waist.
2. Contract your core and raise your hips until your body is in a straight line from head to feet. Hold the position without letting your hips drop for the allotted time. Then go back to the start position and repeat.
 
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Put your arms flat at your sides. Then lift your butt up and down.
 
1. Touch your toes with your hands at the top of movement. Maintain a straight back through the movement. Bend your knees for an easier option.
 
1. Lie on your left side with your forearm supporting your body. Hold your body in a straight line.
 
1. Lie on your right side with your forearm supporting your body. Hold your body in a straight line.
 
1. Lie on your back and start with knees bent and feet on the mat. Arms are crossed and resting on the chest.
2. Bring chin to chest and flex, the head, neck, and torso off the mat coming to a seated position then return back down with control.
 
1. Stand on the floor with your arms extended straight forward at shoulder height.
2. Raise your arms above your head. Return to the start position and repeat.
 
1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. Raise your arms to the sides at shoulders height, then put them down.
2. Repeat the exercise. Keep your arms straight during the exercise.
 
1. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your chest as you point your elbows straight back.
2. Lower your hips in vertical motion, maintaining a straight line from your back to neck. Keep your elbows tucked in behind you and your shoulders away from your ears.
3. Make it easier by moving your feet closer to the chair.
 
1. Stand on the floor with your arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Move your arms clockwise in circles fast. Try to do it as fast as you can.
 
1. Stand on the floor with your arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Move your arms counterclockwise in circles fast. Try to do it as fast as you can.
 
1. Get on all fours with your hands together under your chest. Position your index fingers and thumbs so they are touching, forming a diamond shape, and extend your arms so that your body is elevated and forms a straight line from your head to your feet.
2. Lower your chest towards your hands, ensuring you don’t flare your elbows out to the sides and keeping your back flat. Stop just before your chest touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position.
 
1. Stand against a wall. Lift your right leg up, lean forward and grab underneath your right ankle with your left hand.
2. Bring the ankle up towards the shoulder as much as you can, then lower it and repeat the exercise.
 
1. Stand against a wall. Lift your left leg up, lean forward and grab underneath your left ankle with your right hand.
2. Bring the ankle up towards the shoulder as much as you can, then lower it and repeat the exercise.
 
1. Start in straight arm plank position.
2. Lift your right arm and left leg until they are parallel with the ground. Return to the start position and repeat with the other side.
 
1. Place your hands slightly wider than your shoulders. Slide your shoulders blades down your back, away from your ears.
2. Maintain a straight body throughout the movement. The further you move your feet away from the wall the harder it gets.
 
1. Put your left hand on your back, use your right hand to grab your left elbow and gently pull it. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. Put your right hand on your back, use your left hand to grab your right elbow and gently pull it. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. Stand with your left arm close to a wall. Extend your left arm and put your left hand on the wall, then gently turn your body to the right.
 
1. Stand with your right arm close to a wall. Extend your right arm and put your right hand on the wall, then gently turn your body to the left.
 
1. Sit on floor with your knees bent, feet on floor, hands on floor behind you with fingers pointing toward body. To begin, lift hips off floor.
2. Slowly and gently bend your elbows and lower your body close to the floor and repeat.
 
1. Start a push-up position with your hands directly under your hands directly under your shoulders and feet no more than 12 inches apart.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your body until your upper arms are parallel to floor. Stay in this position for one second and then push your body back to the starting position and repeat the exercise.
 
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place your dominant foot slightly forward. Slightly bend your elbows at 90 degrees.
2. Raise your right arm to shoulder height and keep your forearm parallel to ground. Rotate your shoulders and hips and punch towards the left. Switch slides and repeat.
 
1. Lie on your left side with your knees bent and lifted. Grasp your left hand and put your right hand behind your head.
2. Then raise your upper body by pulling your left thigh. Repeat the exercise.
 
1. Lie on your right side with your knees bent and lifted. Grasp your right hand and put your left hand behind your head.
2. Then raise your upper body by pulling your right thigh. Repeat the exercise.
 
1. Stand upright with your hands beside your ears and elbows facing each side. Rotate your elbows until both of them are facing the front.
 
1. Stand in a doorway. Grasp the doorframe using your left hand and put your feet close to the bottom of the door.
2. Extend your left arm and lean back, then pull at the doorframe and come back to the starting position. Repeat the exercise.
 
1. Stand in a doorway. Grasp the doorframe using your right hand and put your feet close to the bottom of the door.
2. Extend your right arm and lean back, then pull at the doorframe and come back to the starting position. Repeat the exercise.
 
1. Start in standard push-up position but with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees on the ground.
2. Lower your body until your elbows are at 90 degrees. Hold this position.
 
1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. Raise your arms parallel to the ground and bend your elbows.
2. Pull your elbows back and squeeze your shoulder blades. Repeat this exercise.
 
1. Lie on your right side with your right knees slightly bent in front of you and your left leg stretched behind the right leg.
2. Straighten your left arm over your head and gently pull on your left arm over your head and gently pull on your left wrist to stretch the left side of your body. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. Lie on your left side with your left knees slightly bent in front of you and your right leg stretched behind the left leg.
2. Straighten your right arm over your head and gently pull on your right arm over your head and gently pull on your right wrist to stretch the right side of your body. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. On all fours, your knees should be hip with distance and your hands should be directly below your shoulders. Your spine is neutral here.
2. Inhale as you drop your belly and lift your gaze and your bone towards the sky.
3. Exhale and tighten your abs to scoop and curl your spline, moving your head and tailbone closer to each other.
 
1. Sit with your knees bent. Slightly lean your upper body back.
2. Stretch your arms in front of you, then pull your elbows back to make your elbows at a 90-degree angle and squeeze your shoulder blades. Repeat this exercise.
 
1. Start in a kneeling position. Drop your butt toward your heels as you stretch the rest of your body down and forward.
2. In the fully stretched position, rest your arms in a relaxed position along the floor, rest your stomach comfortably on top of your thighs, and rest your forehead on the mat. Hold this position for 30 seconds.
 
1. Lean forward, bend your knees and your elbows. Extend your arms behind you and squeeze your triceps.
2. Please make your arms parallel to ground when extending them. Go back to the start position and repeat this exercise.
 
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart.
2. Sit your hips back and bend your upper body while keeping your upper body straight, then slowly go back to start position and repeat this exercise.
 
1. Start in a push-up position. Lower yourself shift your body to left and then to right.
2. Push your body up and repeat this exercise.
 
1. Lie on your stomach with your arms extended straight overhead. Alternately lift your opposite arm and leg.
 
1. Lie down on your stomach with your toes touching the floor, and your chin on your hand.
2. Raise your chest up as high as possible off the floor. Hold this position for few seconds and then go back to the stat position. Repeat this exercise.
 
1. Assume a push-up position on the floor. Your arms should be straight and your hands should be shoulder apart.
2. Now lift up your hips so that your body forms an upside- down V. Your legs and arms should stay as straight as possible.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your upper body until the top of your head nearly touches the floor. Pause, and then push yourself back up until your arms are straight.
 
1. Get into a normal push-up position, with your hands directly underneath your shoulders.
2. Lower yourself until your chest is an inch above the ground and push your body backward until your arms fully extend, with your knees bent and butt in the air.
3. Bring yourself back into the starting position and repeat this exercise.
 
1. Lay down with your back flat on the floor. Feet also flat on the floor and your knees pointed up towards the ceiling.
2. Arms are out to your side even with shoulder height. Push up on your elbows and raise your upper back up off the ground.
3. Lower your upper back down to the floor and repeat this exercise.
 
1. Place your forehead on the thick part of a mat or folded towel. Lie face down with your hands relaxed at your side.
2. Keeping your shoulders seated tightly in their socket and your arms locked out. Raise your hands overhead. Your hands and arms should remain a few inches off of the ground.
3. Move your hands to your sides. Keep your arms locked out and your shoulders remain seated tightly in their sockets and repeat.
 
1. Stand straight with your hands on the wall and feet shoulder width apart.
2. Lift your heels and stand on your toes. Then drop your heels down. Repeat the exercise.
 
1. Stand straight with your hands on the wall and your feet a little wider than shoulder width apart.
2. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Lift your heels up and down.
 
1. Stand one big step away in front of a wall. Step forward with your right foot and push the wall with your hands.
2. Please make sure your left leg is fully extended and you can feel your left calf stretching. Hold this position for a few seconds.
 
1. Stand one big step away in front of a wall. Step forward with your left foot and push the wall with your hands.
2. Please make sure your right leg is fully extended and you can feel your right calf stretching. Hold this position for a 30 seconds.
 
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands under your shoulders. Then lift your left leg to the side at a 90 degree angle.
 
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands under your shoulders. Then lift your right leg to the side at a 90 degree angle.
 
1. Step forward with a leg and bend it until both legs are in a 90 degree angle. Make sure your body stays in a straight line on top of your rear knee.
2. Push through your front heel to activate your glutes and get back to the starting position.
 
1. Lie on your right side with your head resting on your right hand.
2. Then lift your left leg and rotate your foot in circles.
 
1. Lie on your left side with your head resting on your left hand.
2. Then lift your right leg and rotate your foot in circles.
 
1. Stand with your feet 6 – 12 inches apart. Stretch your arms in front of you.
2. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise.
 
1. Lie facedown on a flat bench, positioning your hips on its edge. Your legs should be straight with your toes high off the floor with your arms on top of the bench. Hold onto the front edge.
2. Squeeze your glutes and hamstrings. Straighten your legs until they are level with your hips. This is the staring position.
3. Lift your left leg higher than your right leg. Lower your left leg as you lift the right one and repeat.
 
1. Keep your legs shoulder width apart and a 90 degree angle on your knees. Push your feet towards the floor and your back against the wall.
 
1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. Put your hands on the wall to maintain balance.
2. Twist your ankles to make your toes point outwards, then lift your heels up and down.
 
1. Stand straight with your right leg lifted. Then hop up and down on your left foot.
 
1. Stand straight with your left leg lifted. Then hop up and down on your right foot.
 
1. Lie on your left side with your head resting on your left hand. Then put your right foot forward on the floor. Lift your left leg up and down.
 
1. Lie on your right side with your head resting on your right hand. Then put your left foot forward on the floor. Lift your right leg up and down.
 
1. Step back diagonally with one leg at a time rear lunge position. Engage your core and keep your upper body straight.
2. Make sure your knees always stay behind your toes.
 
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands directly under your shoulders.
2. Then kick with left leg back until it is parallel with the ground and repeat.
 
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hands directly under your shoulders.
2. Then kick with right leg back until it is parallel with the ground and repeat.
 
1. Lie on the floor with your feet together. Open your knees to the side. Hold this position.
 
1. Stand a big step away from the wall, put your hands on the wall and lean on it.
2. Lift your heels as high as you can and then lower them down. Repeat this exercise.
 
1. Stand a big step away from the wall. Put your right foot on your left ankle. Put your hands on the wall and lean on it.
2. Lift your left heel as high as you can and then lower it. Repeat this exercise.
 
1. Stand a big step away from the wall. Put your left foot on your right ankle. Put your hands on the wall and lean on it.
2. Lift your right heel as high as you can and then lower it. Repeat this exercise.

//Workout Benefits 
1. It help you to relax and ease muscular stress and tension, it give you the six pack abs.
2. Crunches work on your abdominal muscles and help to strengthen your core.
3. Flexing your abdominal muscles on a daily basis will help you to lose weight and gain a flat belly, as well as great posture.
4. Abdominal crunches will also help to maintain the health of your spine.
5. If you are suffering from constipations, strengthening your abdominal press can severely benefit from these exercises.
6. A strong core is important for pregnant women. This type of exercise does not burn a lot of calories, however it will still increase your overall fitness.
 
1. Warms up and stretches the pectoral muscles, upper back muscles, shoulder muscles and upper arm muscles.
2. This exercise will tone your arms and provides strength.
3. It is one of the best cardio workouts to lose weight.
 
1. Lunges are an awesome exercise to tone the muscles of the lower body.
2. Backward lunges are safer for the knees because it’s much easier to emphasize the muscles of the gluts, hamstrings and quads.
3. Backward lunges help you focus more of your work on the large glute muscles.
4. Backward lunges are a great way to warm up and dynamically stretch your muscles.
5. Lung will help improve muscular strength and balance.
 
1. This exercise is for building core strength and toning your things.
2. If you want to lose weight, bicycle crunches are perfect because cycling is one of the most effective cardio exercise.
3. It improves muscle strength and mass.
4. It will help you develop the much in vogue six pack abs when clubbed with other exercises.
 
1. Burpees will help you build discipline and mental toughness.
2. It will improve sports performance and physical skill.
3. It will make your skin glow.
 
1. Stretches muscles in the shoulders, chest and abdominals.
2. Helps to ease symptoms of asthma.
3. Reduces belly fat and relieves stress.
 
1. Lunges are also an excellent way to develop your balance.
2. Lunges can improve your core strength.
 
1. The inchworm is a great bodyweight exercise that warms up the entire body.
2. Increases your balance and stability.
 
1. Warms up the whole body, loosening muscles in the legs, torso and arms.
2. It will improve your stamina, balance and stability.
3. It can relieve stress and also help improve flexibility.
 
1. This helps prevent heart diseases, hypertension and obesity.
2. Jump squats are the most effective exercise for weight loss.
 
1. Mountain climbers require you to engage your upper arm muscles, as well as core and your legs.
2. They benefit muscular and cardiovascular fitness by increasing strength, flexibility and blood circulation.
3. They tone your butt and legs.
 
1. Push-ups burns a lot of calories as you are engaging multiple muscle groups at the same time.
2. Increasing upper body strength, primarily in chest, shoulders, arms and core.
3. Protects your shoulders from injury.
 
1. It will help you develop more explosive leg strength.
2. Side hops can help to increase your performance.
3. It increases aerobic fitness strengthens the heart and boosts your weight loss.
 
1. It is one of the best cardio and HIIT workout.
2. Skipping burns 1300 calories/hour calories in comparison to running.
3. It also helps in improving bone density.
4. Skipping is of the best ways to lose weight.
 
1. Squat exercise help build muscles throughout your body.
2. Good for digestion and help you to remove waste from the body.
3. Increases flexibility and burn more fat for weight loss.
 
1. The incline push-up targets the lower portion of the pectorals major which helps improve the function of moving the arm to and from the center of the body, such as in a fly.
2. Increase blood flow to the upper body, helping to decrease post exercise soreness.
 
1. Improve your posture.
2. Enhance your cardiovascular system.
3. Protect your shoulders from injury.
 
1. It strengthens the core, increase metabolic rate and reduce bone loss.
2. Build thigh muscles and protect from injury.
 
1. Push-ups remain one of the most effective exercises that help you to engage all your upper body getting stronger and fitter.
2. Your will burn more calories, this will help you make your stomach stronger and firmer.
 
1. Reduce soreness if your muscles are tight.
2. Better circulation to help recover from your workout.
 
1. It strengthens and builds up the hip muscles, helping them to look bigger and gives a more defined appearance.
2. This exercise is beneficial as it enhances posture, flexibility, balance and limb speed.
 
1. It strengthens and builds up the hip muscles, helping them to look bigger and gives a more defined appearance.
2. This exercise is beneficial as it enhances posture, flexibility, balance and limb speed.
 
1. It helps in strengthening and lose the fat around your lower back.
2. It helps in reducing cellulite.
3. This exercise effectively targets and activates your glutes and firms and strengthens your butt and thighs.
 
1. It helps in strengthening and loses the fat around your lower back.
2. It helps in reducing cellulite.
